Case reference: 2014004126.CaseDesc: René Jacques was reported missing on July 16, 1988, by his friend whom he lived with in Piopolis. He had left his family's home in Piopolis to live with his friend on July 7, 1988. It was not the first time René had left the family residence, but he always came back after some time.

Case reference: 2014006426.CaseDesc: Sara Coates was last seen in the Stanley Park area in Calgary, Alberta. Ms. Coates was leading a nomadic lifestyle, living out of her van with her dog and 3 cats, travelling around Alberta and BC. Ms. Coates’ van was located October 22, 2013, in a secluded area of Morley, Alberta. It appeared to have been there for some time. Police investigations regarding Ms. Coates’ whereabouts are ongoing.

Scar: 2 small surgical scars on inner groin

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2012020094.CaseDesc: Gordon Harvey was last seen on July 24, 2008, at approximately 2130 hours. He was swimming in the Saskatchewan River near Cranberry Flats, south of Saskatoon, SK. Personal clothing and articles of identification belonging to Mr. Harvey were recovered on the shore near where he was last seen swimming.

Case reference: 2014003679.CaseDesc: In December 1983, Konrad Murach was last seen by his family. Since this time, Konrad has not been seen nor has anyone heard from him.

Case reference: 2013000034.CaseDesc: Lucie Constantineau was last seen on July 25, 2008 in the Parc-Extension in Montreal, Quebec. Lucie was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Teeth: Braces, partial denture on the 4 front teeth of the upper jaw
Amputation: Right Ear, Missing part of an ear lobe

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014005450.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1979 James Gordon Nevin departed from his residence in Amherstburg, Ontario heading west for a 2 week vacation with the intention of visiting relatives. Mr. Nevin had a grandson in Winnipeg, Manitoba and a son in Prince George, British Columbia. Neither relative had prior notification Mr. Nevin's intentions to visit.   On June 14, 1979 the RCMP responded to a call and James Nevin's vehicle, a 1974 white/maroon Dodge Coronet, was located in a ditch between Rocanville, Saskatchewan and St. Lazare, Manitoba. Inquiries reveal the vehicle was at this location since June 8, 1979.   Mr. Nevin has never been seen again and likely went missing between 1:30 pm and 3:00 pm on June 8, 1979. Extensive searches were conducted by land and air all with negative results. James Gordon Nevin was never seen again. Foul play cannot be ruled out.

Scar: Right Thumb, Skin graft scar on right or left thumb

Case reference: 2014005108.CaseDesc: On May 20, 2008, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Zhebglin Park was seen for the last time at his home in the Tom Clove Villa Residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019072428.CaseDesc: In April of 2019, Corey Baldwin was seen for the last time in Ottawa, Ontario. It is out of character for Corey not to contact his father for an extended period of time. It is possible that Corey may be in British Columbia or Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Middle Back, Dragon on entire back
Left Arm, Sleeve with a graffiti wreath
Right Arm, Cartoon wolf with a police hat
Right Arm, A full sleeve to the elbow
Left Upper Arm, Inside left bicep written "I love her"
Scar: Chest, 2-3 Inches, a horizontal deep scar on the sternum
Lower Back, Surgical scar, horseshoe shape on the tailbone

Case reference: 2015011646.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1999, an adult male believed to be between the ages of 40-45 was seen by a train conductor, walking on the edge of the railway in Dorval, Quebec. A few minutes later, the adult male laid down on the railroad tracks and was crushed by the wheels of the train.

Sweater: White, Levi's brand, short sleeve T-shirt, size Large/Extra Large
Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Windbreaker, Columbia brand

Case reference: 2014003250.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1974, four people left the Whitedog Indian Reserve, Ontario in a 14' Lund boat and were heading for Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. Their intention was to go to Pointe du Bois to pick up supplies and then return to Whitedog. On November 5, 1974, these individuals were reported missing as they had never returned to Whitedog.  It is believed that the boat overturned and everyone drowned. Two bodies were recovered, and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. Searches were conducted by boat and by air but the bodies of Paul Scott and Richard Petawanahqueb were never recovered.  Mr. Scott and Mr. Petawanahqueb are presumed dead due to drowning. No foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Other: Walks bent forward with hands behind his back

Case reference: 2019052112.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1974, the body of an elderly man was found in a parking lot on East Hastings St in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had grey hair and a moustache and was believed to be living a transient lifestyle. He died of heart disease.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2005003799.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1975, an unidentified woman was found on the beach of Confederation Park of Lake Ontario in Hamilton. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150 lbs. however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Her appendix was not present. She may have been in the water for up to a year.

Teeth: Gold Visible, Several molar teeth are missing and she has a gold crown on her upper left premolar
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gruen brand watch model N225
Gold, Gold, Ring size 6, emerald stone with small diamonds on each sides
Gold, Gold, Yellow, 14kt wedding band, Blue River brand, size 6.5
Shoes: Brown, Oxford orthopedic shoes with 1.5 inch heel

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2014005674.CaseDesc: Ms. Loughran went missing some time on or after March 4, 2006, when she was last seen. Ms. Loughran left the Aspen Grove area of Grovedale, Alberta, in a white Chevrolet truck and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: Howard Graveline dissappeared from his home on décembre 29, 2011.  His car, passport and wallet were left behind.

Case reference: 2006001699.CaseDesc:
On July 27, 1992, the body of a male, believed to be Caucasian, was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His upper right central incisor had a root canal treatment and there was a metallic restoration at its root end. There were several other sites of root canal treatment.
His appendix was present and he was uncircumcised.

Teeth: Many post. teeth & U-left lat. incisor:missing before death. Many fillings amalgam & composite. U-right cent. incisor: grey
Shoes: Blue and white "L.A. Gear" running shoes
Shirt: Black, T-shirt, "True North Sweats Designer " brand

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2014002212.CaseDesc: On July 30, 1996, Betty Primeau was last seen while berry picking in the Torch River area near Choiceland, SK. Mrs. Primeau was with a group of other individuals prior to being reported missing. Extensive searches have failed to locate Mrs. Primeau.

Case reference: 2014004770.CaseDesc: At approximately 11:00 p.m. on April 17, 2006, Sangeeta Khanna called a family member and told him that she was going to stop at the bank and then would be home shortly. In the morning when she did not arrive the police were called. Her vehicle was located abandoned in a parking lot in Edmonton and she has not been seen since. The investigation is ongoing and investigators believe that Sangeeta may be the victim of foul play.

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2021036756.CaseDesc: On August 6, 2021, Curtis Thorne was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Curtis was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles
Left Hand, Letters "DIE ALONE" on the knuckles

Case reference: 2014002093.CaseDesc: Wilhemina (Winnie) Wanner went missing from her home on January 3rd, 1989 in Red Deer, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014001173.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1979, this unidentified individual was involved in a fatal motor vehicle collision near Wildwood, Alberta, and the remains were burned beyond recognition. The individual is believed to be a hitchhiker from Quebec, possibly named John. There are no dental restorations present and a few teeth had been extracted.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, Ski Jacket, Ski jacket with red and white stripes on the sleeve

Case reference: 2014004628.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2005, Patrick Marshall left his residence located North East of Jean Cote in Alberta. Patrick left a note saying he was going to Calgary with a friend and would be in touch in a few weeks. He left with minimal clothes and toiletries.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown, turning grey

Case reference: 2014004162.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1987, Charles Eddy was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Moncton, New Brunswick, where he lived with his brother. Charles suffered from partial schizophrenia, was known to be heavy smoker and carry large sums of money.

Case reference: 2017019146.CaseDesc: On April 12, 2017, Hélène Martineau was seen for the last time when she left her home in the Ste-Thérèse sector in Jonquière, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Grey, Blue, Merrel brand, walking shoe

Case reference: 2014001313.CaseDesc: On August 26, 1976, at 11:00 pm, Frederick Seymour was seen for the last time as he stood outside of his residence in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Seymour had been seen by his neighbour.

Case reference: 2013000090.CaseDesc: On June 16, 1983, Nicola Michel Tola was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He was suppose to come home and make dinner but he was never seen again by his family. His car was located at the Pie IX shopping mall.

Case reference: 2006008099.CaseDesc: Wilbert James Coulter's abandoned pick-up truck was located on December 28, 1990 on an old snowmobile trail in the Bancroft, Ontario area.  Search of the area failed to locate Mr. Coulter.

Case reference: 2014004987.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2004, Cassandra Wright was seen for the last time leaving the Homewood Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Cassandra said that she would be back in the morning.

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 2014006306.CaseDesc: Shelly Dene was reported missing to the EPS by a family member on November 8, 2013. She had been out of family contact since approximately August 2013. Family is concerned for her welfare as it is unusual for her to be out of contact for this length of time. Shelly resided in Kelowna BC before moving to Edmonton in June 2013.

Case reference: 2006012299.CaseDesc: On June 02, 1984, Andrew Grinnell, his brother,their cousin and a friend  departed Sioux Lookout on a canoe trip on the Albany River. The party arrived in Fort Albany on July 18, 1984. At 6:00 p.m. that same day, the party decided to leave Fort Albany in an attempt to paddle to Moosonee via James Bay. The group had planned to go out onto James Bay with the tide and sail to Moosonee by lashing their canoes together. An intense storm engulfed the James Bay coastal area on July 23, 1984, and it is likely that the party perished on the Bay during this storm. Three victims were recovered in August 1984, twelve nautical miles North of the Moose River. Mr. Grinnell's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2019059675.CaseDesc: On February 26, 1989, the body of an unidentified man was found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had an abdominal hernia, and poor dental hygiene. The results of the autopsy showed evidence of chronic alcohol abuse, and he was likely despondent prior to his death.

Pants: Dark Blue, Marks and Spencer brand
Suit: Black, Osman Brand, Warm up suit, X Large

Case reference: 2014003751.CaseDesc: Lucien Sale was last seen driving his truck in Chisholm, Alberta on September 21, 1991. On September 26, 1991, his truck was located abandoned on a logging road off into the bush.

Case reference: 2016040859.CaseDesc: On July 19, 2016, Deana Mildred Wertz was last seen at her residence on Yankee Flats Road near Salmon Arm BC. Later that same morning she spoke with family members by phone indicating she was going for a hike without her dog which was unusual. The area where Deanna is believed to have gone is the area surrounding Yankee Flats Rd near Salmon Arm BC which is steep mountainous terrain with a number of trail systems. She left without any personal possessions, cash or identification.

Case reference: 2012020144.CaseDesc: This body was recovered from the Esquimalt Lagoon.

Teeth: Braces, Upper jaw intact and shows clear evidence of dental work (metal fillings).

Case reference: 2013000046.CaseDesc: On June 27, 2004, Richard McGuire was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district of Montreal, Quebec. His vehicle was found in a garage located in the municipality of St-Elzear in the La Nouvelle-Beauce Regional County in Quebec.

Case reference: 2006009499.CaseDesc: On February 23, 2003, Fred Takerer was reported missing by his son. Mr. Takerer had physical limits and was not able to get around easily. Police have not been able to locate Mr. Takerer and believe his disappearance to be suspicious.

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2006008399.CaseDesc: Joseph Niro last contacted his daughter by telephone on June 02, 1999. He was last seen on June 20, 1999.

Hair: Black, Long, Wavy, Parted to the right

Case reference: 2018063460.CaseDesc: On October 13, 1992, at approximately 8:30 am, Debra Kumar was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004632.CaseDesc: On May 9th, 2005, Dean Phillips  was reported missing by his family in Campbell River, British Columbia. Dean was  last seen at a local school in Campbell River and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000040.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2002, Bruce Forbes was seen for the last time at a Regent Road residence in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Mr. Forbes suffered from a serious health condition, and required medication on a daily basis. It is believed that Mr. Forbes was not in possession of this medication at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2009004299.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1973, Madeleine Van Overdijk was reported missing by her husband.  She was last seen at her residence in Brantford, Ontario. Information reported to police suggested she was going to Toronto.  It is unknown if in fact she made it to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014002202.CaseDesc: On May 5, 1991, Doctor Jitinkumar Devchand Karamshi Shah, a physician with Sir Thomas Roddick Hospital in Stephenville, Newfoundland, was last seen at 2:45 in the morning. After a night out at a local club, Dr. Shah dropped a friend off at their residence and continued walking home. Dr. Shah was born in Nairobi, Kenya and previously lived and worked in Sheffield, England.

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2014005011.CaseDesc: On July 28, 2005, at approximately 6:15 p.m., Senekinesh Qirma was seen for the last time at the Eaton Centre in Toronto, Ontario. Senekinesh was in Canada on a visitor’s visa.

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Scar: Eyes, Below eye, unknown which eye

Case reference: 2006012499.CaseDesc: On November 17, 1999, the skeletal remains of a male was found along the north bank of St. Mary's River in Bell's Point Park, Garden River First Nation, east of Sault Ste. Marie. It is estimated that he had been dead for at least three years or more.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations in his lower teeth and evidence of tooth decay.

Case reference: 2016034244.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on October 31, 1981 about 7 kms east of Hinton, AB just off Highway #16. The individual did not have teeth and no dentures were found with the body.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2006004499.CaseDesc: James Pearce was last seen in the Grafton area on October 5, 1999. On October 8, 1999, his 1949 pink Dodge pick-up truck was located at the Cobourg train station parking lot.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Brush Cut, Recent #2 cut at time of disappearance
Tattoo: Right Hand, Banner with the name Laurie
Left Arm, Skeleton with top hat
Scar: Torso (Back), Numerous scars from an accident
Head, A 1 inch scar under hair on left side
Left Leg, Scar from a fracture

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Qebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2018040305.CaseDesc: On the morning of April 10, 2001, Joo Youn was seen for the last time as she sent her children off to school in Toronto, Ontario. Later that day, when Joo’s husband returned home she was gone and she had left a note.

Case reference: 2018054176.CaseDesc: On February 15, 1992, at approximately 10:00pm, Adu Frimpong was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020079.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1991, Lavina Tocher, 35 years old, was last seen in Parkman, SK. On the 12th of December of that year, Ms. Tocher was reported missing by an anonymous caller. Investigation and searches have failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: Brian ADRAIN's abandoned vehicle was located in Kananaskis area west of Millarville, Alberta, known as McLean Creek.

Case reference: 2014005555.CaseDesc: In April, 2000, Magdalena Ciesek was last seen in Toronto, Ontario at the intersection of Dundas Street W. and Roncesvalles Avenue.

Case reference: 2014006374.CaseDesc: Rosalie Jean ALLAN was last seen at the end of November, start of December 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2012020070.CaseDesc: Leslie Thomas was reported missing December 8, 2000.  He was last seen walking west on Hwy #201 of the Roseau River First Nation in the first week of November.  Mr. Thomas' whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2010001199.CaseDesc: Michael Hinsperger was in a canoe on Carson Lake, Barry's Bay, at 3:00 P.M. on May 13th 2010. The canoe was recovered but Mr. Hinsperger has not been located.

Jacket: Black, Yellow lettering "Harley Davidson Owners club"

Case reference: 2014003811.CaseDesc: On December 28, 1988, Murray Copp was seen for the last time at the Salvation Army Community and Family Services Centre in Moncton, New Brunswick.

Scar: Nose, Between eyes and above nose

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2014003747.CaseDesc: Karoly John "Charles" Horvath, a visitor from England, arrived in Kelowna BC in early May 1989.  He worked throughout the community at part time jobs and stayed in a local hostel and at a local campground.  He was last seen on Friday, May 26, 1989.  All his belongings were left behind at the campground where he had been staying.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, side profile of a skull with mohawk style haircut

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)
Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2014001648.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1986, Gustave Focktave was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Côte-Des-Neiges-Notre-Dame-De-Grâce District of Montreal, Quebec. Gustave had left without his possessions and had left a farewell letter addressed to his family indicating that he would be hitchhiking to British Columbia to live in Vancouver. Gustave is originally from Madagascar.

Case reference: 2016061088.CaseDesc:
On April 25, 1982, the remains of a Black female were found in the Detroit River, near Maple Leaf Mills processing plant, in the city of Windsor, Ontario. Her appendix was present.
She is estimated to have been in the water for 2-4 weeks.

Pants: Beige, Red, Checkered pants with an elastic waist band
Jacket: Light Blue, White, Waist length button down jacket with white edging. Burn mark on the right sleeve.
Tattoo: Right Thigh, Mid-thigh, described as a "Bulls Eye", with the word "Lots" or "Lets"
Scar: Left Chest, 42 cm Thoracotomy scar with metal surgical sutures

Case reference: 2014002164.CaseDesc: Michael Strang was last seen November 21, 1990. Strang was a patient at Centracare psychiatric hospital where he reportedly left from a 3rd story window. Strang has not been heard from since.

Tattoo: Winged Heart - not sure which arm

Case reference: 2020011692.CaseDesc: Joyce MacDougall was last heard from on March 13, 1986, at approximately 7:30pm. Joyce telephoned her mother to inform her that she was going out for a few drinks, but she never returned home. On March 14, Joyce interacted with the police in Niagara Falls and during the course of the interaction she was issued a ticket and was taken to a restaurant. She was last seen at the restaurant by a server and had left her purse in the restaurant.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the left side of the cheek

Case reference: 2016059696.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2016, at approximately 1:00 a.m., Michelle Byron was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Other, WINTER, Dark coloured winter coat

Case reference: 2021000851.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Kyle Leblanc was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Kyle was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band

Case reference: 2014001063.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1980, the remains of an adult male were found in the Fraser River near Mission, British Columbia. He had no teeth and probably wore dentures. He had two healed vertical scars on the abdomen below the navel and estimated to have died several months prior to discovery.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical scar from Umbilicus to sternum
Abdomen, Surgical scar in rectus area

Case reference: 2014002095.CaseDesc: On May 10, 1980 four men from Grand Forks, North Dakota departed in a boat from the Anama Bay Tourist Camp (Manitoba) for a fishing trip. At approximately 2:45 p.m. on this date an overturned boat was spotted in the Sturgeon Bay area of Lake Winnipeg. The bodies of three of the four men were found. The cause of death for all three of these men was death due to cold exposure (in water) and drowning. The body of William Winters was never recovered. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014001140.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1973, the skeletal remains of a male were discovered 30 miles south of Kashechewan and 60 miles west of Moosonee - 30 feet from a small creek that flows into James Bay. He is estimated to have been dead for 9-12 months.

Case reference: 2012020172.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were found in a wooded area in Surrey, near Scott Road and 64th Avenue.

Case reference: 2017074170.CaseDesc: On October 8, 2015, an unidentified man was found in Lake Ontario in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010003599.CaseDesc: Alexander McAuley was reported missing by family members on April 23, 2010, after not having any contact with him since 2002. Mr. McAuley was known to lead a high risk lifestyle and may have met with foul play.

Case reference: 2012020157.CaseDesc: The partial skeletal remains of this adult male were recovered on a ranch property on Lindley Creek Road in close proximity to the Shulus Indian Reserve in Merritt BC.

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021030112.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2021, Jeanette Marcotte was reported missing in Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette was last seen in Saskatchewan in 1981 or 1982, where she stated that she was headed to Vancouver, British Columbia. Jeanette has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003874.CaseDesc: Marthe Turcotte was last seen in Montreal on September 13, 1971. Her sister dropped her off at the Jean-Talon metro station but she was never seen again. Marthe was a student in Nursing at Thetford CEGEP in Thetford Mines.
